intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The snow is really coming down all of a sudden. Is everyone OK?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: I believe so. But...it looks like we've been separated from the others.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Damn, you're right! We have to find them and quickly!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Don't worry, Corrin. Felicia/Jakob knows this area well, so they should be fine. Honestly, I'm more concerned about the two of us... We must keep pushing forward before we freeze to death.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very true. We better hurry before the path Felicia/Jakob showed us is covered in snow.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: It's f-freezing...and now the snow's so thick I can hardly see anything. Felicia/Jakob said it gets colder the closer you get to the Ice Tribe village. We must be on the right track. Right, Silas?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: So it would seem.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We must carry on. But my mind is...suddenly...hazy... And I can't...feel my...legs...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin!!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: S-sorry, Silas. I'm fine, really. I just...fell a little. No big deal... Are you sleepy? I'm suddenly...so very...so very sleepy...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin, no! Please, stay with me! You must not fall asleep!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'll get up soon, Elise. Just five more...minutes... Xander can wait... ... ...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin? Corrin!
Halt! Who goes there?!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: What the...?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Arghh... Whaaa...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin! Thank goodness... For a while there, I thought I'd lost you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Silas? What happened? I remember falling, and then everything went black. More importantly, where are we?

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: You are safe now, young traveler. Welcome to my village. I am Kilma, leader of the Ice Tribe.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Kilma... Thank you for your kindness. It would seem you saved my life. My name is Corrin. I am the second prince/princess of the kingdom of N—

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin! You should rest. NOW. You've had a long day.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Silas?

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: Is something the matter?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: My apologies, Kilma. Corrin just woke up—his/her mind is still foggy. Perhaps you would allow him/her to rest a bit more before we resume the introductions?

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: ...Yes, of course. I'll go prepare something warm to drink. Please excuse me.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Phew...that was a close call.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Silas, what was all that about? I feel fine.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Don't forget yourself, my lord/milady. It could prove deadly.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: I know all of this is new to you, but don't forget we came to suppress a rebellion. That means the Ice Tribe is disgruntled with the actions of the Kingdom of Nohr. In other words, we are their enemy. To identify yourself as a Nohrian prince/princess, especially while in a weakened state... It's simply a bad idea, old friend.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Sound advice, Silas. You're right. I forgot myself for a moment.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Understandable for one who barely made it back to the land of the living. But we must exercise caution, or neither of us will ever see home again.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: There's such a fine line between friend and foe, war and peace. It's all so...gray.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Such is the world we live in, I'm afraid. I must say, you truly have a remarkable knack for getting into trouble. I never thought this is how we'd breach the village. What should we do now?

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: A fresh pot of hot tea, as promised. This should help clear your head.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Th-thank you very much.

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: You know, I usually would not allow strangers into my village like this. However, I made an exception for you two. It's that sword you carry, Corrin. That golden blade looks just like that of the hero of legend... It is said the one who wields that blade is destined to save the world.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: My Yato... A legendary sword... Well, it's a nice thought.

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: As you can imagine, I simply couldn't abandon you after I saw that blade. Who knows, maybe you are the hero the world has been waiting for. If so, then there's a chance we will one day break free from those cruel Norhians.

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: If you'll excuse me, I believe I've babbled on about old Ice Tribe legends long enough. Ah, it looks like my daughter has finally arrived. Allow me to introduce you...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Corrin? Is that you?!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What the... Flora?! What are you doing here?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I could ask you the same thing. And I shall. Why are you here, my liege?

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: My liege?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: This isn't good...

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Brother/Sister! Yaaay, I knew you'd make it!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: What a relief! I was so worried once I realized we had gotten separated.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: F-Flora?! What are YOU doing here?! You told me you were going to hold down the fort while I was gone...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I changed my mind. Why did you and the others follow me here?

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Follow you? No way! I had no idea you were even here.

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Flora?! Why are you here? Didn't you agree to hold down the fort in my absence? Don't tell me Felicia is here too...

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: No, she's not. I came alone. Why did you and the others follow me here?

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Nonsense. Whyever would we follow you? I didn't even know you were here.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Yeah, that's right! We got here all by ourselves! We can't go back until we suppress the Ice Tribe rebellion like Father ordered!

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: WHAT?!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Elise, why would you say that?!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Huh? What do you mean? It's not a secret. Wait...doesn't suppress mean... You know, that we ask them to please stop rebelling? And maybe eat dinner together?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Elise, you don't understand. It's not that easy.

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: All has become clear as ice. You monsters tricked me into helping you so so you could infiltrate my village.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I promise you, that was not our intention.

intro.speaker: Kilma
intro.line: Don't play dumb. Such childish games do not befit a prince/princess, even one of Nohr. I know how you Nohrians operate. Well, so be it. Flora! You know what must be done.

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Yes, Father. I will sound the alarm right away. The Nohrians have infiltrated our village. They must be expelled immediately. And permanently.

intro.speaker: Felicia
intro.line: Flora! H-How could you say such a dreadful thing? Fighting was supposed to be a last resort! Can't we talk this out? Or at least try to?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: Felicia, dear sister... You've always been ignorant to the ways of the Nohrians. War is the only language they understand. Side with them and you'll pay the price!

intro.speaker: Jakob
intro.line: Flora! How could you say that? Do you really intend to attack Corrin?

intro.speaker: Flora
intro.line: I have no choice, Jakob. You wouldn't understand. The Nohrians... War is the only language they understand. Side with them and you'll pay the price!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: That could have gone better... Be on your guard, Corrin!

battle.speaker: Kilma
battle.line: The time has come to defeat the Nohrian army. Inform the villagers!

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Sounds like Kilma is dead set on calling in reinforcements from the village. Maybe if we can get to them first, we can dissuade them from fighting...

battle.speaker: Kilma
battle.line: Did you truly manage to melt the lake's ice with the power of Dragon Veins? Well, it was all for nothing. This sacred land is blessed with divine protection. By the power of the Ice Dragon, our lake will freeze once more!

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: The darkness is calling...whispering... SEETHING. It's saying...hmmmm... Ahhh, I understand. The shadows within say our foes are unwitting yet dangerous. So it has been decided by the treacherous hand of fate. We have no choice... We must use the darkness swarming inside me to claim the golden glow of victory!

battle.speaker: Niles
battle.line: You're a damn weirdo, Odin. But you know that, don't you? In any case, I'm not going to let you take all the glory for yourself.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Uh, what's going on over there? Who are you?

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: Didn't you hear me? About the darkness?! Sheesh, some people are so rude. Well, it can't be helped. Who am I, you ask...

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: I am none other than... Odin Dark! I am the keeper of darkness, chosen protector of the youngest Nohrian prince!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: So...you're Leo's retainer? And he sent you here to help me?

battle.speaker: Niles
battle.line: Yes, that would be the sane version of what Odin just said. My name is Niles. By royal decree of Lord Leo, I am here to serve you.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Serve me? I would rather you fight at my side as a friend and equal...

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: Don't worry about Niles. He's always like this. I suspect he's bitter that the dark spirits chose to inhabit me and not him... But back to the matter at hand. Don't be afraid, Lord/Lady Corrin... I will now use my powers to expel those who wronged you from this world. Ahh...the power! My fell hand awakens... It longs for the blood of our foes! I must annihilate them all, or the curse will surely—

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Woah, there! Take it easy. Let's all just calm down, OK?

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: What, why? But my sword...the curse... What's the holdup?

battle.speaker: Niles
battle.line: Is there a problem? When can we start inflicting pain?

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Um, no offense... I'm happy you came to help and all, but you're creeping me out. Besides, I would like to settle this dispute with as little bloodshed as possible.

battle.speaker: Niles
battle.line: So we can inflict pain so long as it doesn't cause bloodshed? Interesting challenge...

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: No. Just...no.

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: But I prepared at least a dozen torturous moves just for today! I named them all, too. They might be my best names yet...

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: I'm very sorry for the, um, inconvenience, but I'm going to have to put my foot down.

battle.speaker: Niles
battle.line: Well, if it's an order from my liege's royal sibling, I am obliged to obey. I may appear somewhat despicable, but I have the utmost loyalty for Lord Leo.

battle.speaker: Odin
battle.line: I, too, am a bastion of loyalty, despite the dark forces beckon me from beyond. It will be hard to hold back my true power, but for you, I'll see what I can do.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Thank you, gentlemen. Now let's finish this quickly!

visit.speaker: Child
visit.line: Whoa, a soldier! What's goin' on? Huh? Don't leave my house today? Well, if you say so. I'll tell my family.

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: The N-Nohrian army?! Leave me alone! I have nothing of value, I promise! I know, I'll lock myself inside. Oh, this is just awful. I hate being cooped up...

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: So you've come at last. Scoundrels! Well, if you're going to kill me, get on with it! Huh? You're not going to kill me? I'm so confused... I'm locking up now. Don't come knockin' again, y'hear?

visit.speaker: Boy
visit.line: Ahhh! The N-Nohrian army is here?! But no... we're not ready to fight yet! Look, we surrender, OK? You win! We will not fight. Please spare my family!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: As daughter of the Ice Tribe's leader, it is my duty to protect our people!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Argh! J-just finish it, why don't you? No point in showing mercy now...

boss.speaker: Kilma
boss.line: We are a proud people, and we shall not yield to the Kingdom of Nohr!

boss.speaker: Kilma
boss.line: You didn't take my life when you had the chance... Why? Tell me why!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: I'm sorry, Corrin. Not for my actions, but for this unfortunate circumstance. Milord/Milady, as your retainer, I know this is tantamount to treason. But my family... My tribe... We simply cannot bow down to Nohrian rule.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: Flora... No need to apologize. I am the last person ever to begrudge you for your loyalties, my friend. Still, I shall do all I can to suppress this rebellion, albeit in my own way.

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Felicia, my foolish sister. Did you really think this rebellion could be solved by a few pretty words?

boss.speaker: Felicia
boss.line: I'm no fool, Flora! You're the one who wants to fight without hearing us out! That in itself is a betrayal of pride and morality our tribe holds so dear!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: You really don't understand, do you? This goes beyond words. Don't you realize, all of our time in that castle was... I mean, it was just...

boss.speaker: Felicia
boss.line: What are you saying, sister?

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Forget it, there's no point telling you now, after all that's happened. Let's get on with it. You may be my sister, but I won't go easy on you!

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Jakob... It's good to see you, though I wish it was under better circumstances.

boss.speaker: Jakob
boss.line: Flora... When I left you at the castle, I never dreamed I'd find you here. Here with your blade raised in anger against he/she who you swore to protect. I know the difficulty of your situation, but that doesn't excuse your actions. I'm afraid I have no choice to settle this matter with force.

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: Jakob... In the b-beginning, I never swore my allegiance. I refused. After all, we were little more than hostages. Taken as children... All to prevent this from happening, to stop the Ice Tribe from rebelling. I often thought of running away, but I never did. I stayed...because of you...

boss.speaker: Jakob
boss.line: Flora...

boss.speaker: Flora
boss.line: I don't want or need your pity, Jakob! Let's finish this!

boss.speaker: Kilma
boss.line: I was a fool to allow myself to be deceived by appearances. You are not the legendary hero after all. What a shame.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I make no excuses for what my people have done to yours, Kilma. No matter how this ends, all I ask is that you listen to what I have to say.

boss.speaker: Kilma
boss.line: Felicia, my dear child. I never thought I'd see this day. Taking up arms against your own people, siding with the enemy...

boss.speaker: Felicia
boss.line: Father, please don't say such things! This is the last thing I ever wanted.

boss.speaker: Kilma
boss.line: It pains me to raise a hand against my precious daughter... But alas, this is how it must be for the good of the tribe. Gods, forgive me.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: The battle is over, at least for now. Thanks to your valiant efforts, we managed a victory without taking any lives. Elise, will you please attend to the injured, regardless of what side they fought on?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Leave it to me! I'll have them all healed up before you can say "Elise is the best!"

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: The Nohrian army fought a battle without murder or brutality? How is this possible? What are you playing at, Prince/Princess of Nohr?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: This is no game, Kilma. I don't believe in killing for the sake of killing. Nor am I inclined to repay kindness with violence. I still owe you my life, after all.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: Even though we attacked you first, while you were weak, you still showed mercy...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I would love nothing more than for this day to mark a turning point, for all of us. One fueled not by force, nor control, but by mutual trust. I know it will take time. It won't be easy, but in my heart I know it's the only way. When my Father ordered me to quell this rebellion, I knew I had to do it my way. Whatever the consequences, I want to build a world we can all live in peacefully.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Could it be...you really did intend to stop this rebellion with words, as Elise said? I would say it must be hereditary, but Elise isn't actually your blood relative.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: Wait, then are you not a prince/princess of Nohr after all?!

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Lord/Lady Corrin! Is this true?! I don't believe it!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It is true, Flora. I found out during my brief time in Hoshido. I am not King Garon's true son/daughter, nor this kingdom's true prince/princess. But I wish nothing more than to end this war, for all of us and for all kingdoms. That is why I must do all I can to make Father recognize me as his son/kin again.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: I had no idea. I seem to have missed a lot after leaving the Northern Fortress...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Forgive me, Lord Kilma. I know what I'm about to ask is a somewhat selfish request. But I must ask all the same... Will you and your tribe agree to halt your rebellion? In return, I promise to do all I can to give your people back your autonomy. I will not rest until the Ice Tribe regains the freedoms Nohr so cruelly stripped away. But for this to happen, I must first ask for your cooperation.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: ... You are full of surprises, young prince/princess. I never thought I would say this, but you may count on our full cooperation.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Kilma! I...thank you! I swear to you, you won't regret this.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: There's a fierce kindness in your eyes, a mysterious calmness in your words. I'm afraid I can't help but take you at your word, Lord/Lady Corrin. If King Garon had said those same words, it would have made no difference. But you... You are a different story. I can't help but believe in you. Perhaps... Perhaps you are the hero that will save this world after all.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Haha, I'm not so sure about that last part, but I thank you for your trust.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, can you ever forgive me? I know I betrayed my oath to serve you and ran away from the castle, but...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No need to apologize, Flora. You did nothing wrong. It was wrong of the Nohrian kingdom to corner you like that, especially as a child. I will, as ever, speak highly of you to Father.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: Your kindness knows no bounds, Lord/Lady Corrin. Thank you. Though I previously refused to do so, I here and now swear my fealty to you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Haha, no need to go overboard, Flora. Without you and Felicia, I would have died of loneliness in the Northern Fortress. You have more than proven your fealty to me, as well as your friendship.

end.speaker: Flora
end.line: But that was all just a big... I mean, that whole time... ... I guess it doesn't matter now anymore. From now on, I promise to be truly loyal to you.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm not sure I fully understand, but the sentiment is much appreciated.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: We're done healing everyone, Corrin! Easier done than said, heehee.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Elise. And you too, Felicia/Jakob. You both did well today.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Indeed, we all did! Now all we need is for King Garon to recognize your victory...

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Oh, I forgot about that part! What are we going to do? You were supposed to stop the rebellion on your own, but we ruined everything. We've got to come up with some great excuse to tell Father or he'll be angry!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Ugh, I had forgotten that part too. Well, I'll consider my options on the way home.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: Are you leaving already? Can I not persuade you to stay and rest a while?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm afraid time is of the essence, Lord Kilma. Next time we meet...I dearly hope the world will be a better place.

end.speaker: Kilma
end.line: I have every confidence it will be, Lord/Lady Corrin. May the gods protect you on your perilous journey toward peace.

end.speaker: Old Man
end.line: Lord/Lady Corrin, please wait! Us villagers wish to thank you. You went out of your way to prevent us from engaging in a futile battle. Though our soldiers tried to defeat you, you still protected and even healed us. Take this as a token of our appreciation. Please, I insist!
